channel.title: Comments on: Hector asks, “Do I have to eject USB drives?”
channel.description: Tech news worth talking about and tech help worth listening to

item.title: By: Richard Becker
item.dc:creator: Richard Becker
item.description:
I was unaware of the limited number of times that a flash drive can be written to and am wondering if this applies to mass flash storage units such as in my MacBook Pro, which uses flash memory instead of a hard drive. Also, I'm not sure how secure delete, which normally overwrites a sector many times, works with Flash Memory. Will these multiple overwrites affect the life of the drive?
Thanks,
item.content:encoded:
I was unaware of the limited number of times that a flash drive can be written to and am wondering if this applies to mass flash storage units such as in my MacBook Pro, which uses flash memory instead of a hard drive. Also, I’m not sure how secure delete, which normally overwrites a sector many times, works with Flash Memory. Will these multiple overwrites affect the life of the drive?

Thanks,
